p: Zn is essential for the division and differentiation of new cells, and it plays a role in apoptosis and the ageing of the body [ 99, 100]. The element influences the structure and proper functioning of the skin and mucous membranes [ 98, 100]. It stabilizes skin cell membranes and participates in basal cell mitosis and differentiation [ 106], while also playing crucial roles in the survival of keratinocytes. The ZIP2 protein, a zinc transporter, is essential for the differentiation of keratinocytes [ 103].
